contents.p: Use the tab key to navigate the interactive elements with Firefox.

ul.li: Can I identify the control or link with keyboard focus?
Can I navigate to all interactive elements?
Can I activate all the links and actions on the page?

contents.p: Use Accessibility Bookmarklets to highlight landmarks on the page and AInspector Sidebar for evaluating landmark rules.

ul.li: Is there a main landmark identifying the primary content of the page?
Is there a banner landmark identifying the content at the beginning of the page?
Is there a contentinfo landmark identifying the content at the end of the page??
Is there a navigation landmark identifying links for navigating the website?
Is all content in a landmark?
If more than one landmark of the same type do they have unique accessible names?

contents.p: Use Accessibility Bookmarklets to highlight headings on the page and AInspector Sidebar for evaluating heading rules.

ul.li: Is there a h1 heading identifying the start of the primary content of the page?
Are headings used to identify section of the page?
Are headings properly nested?

contents.p: Use AInspector Sidebar for evaluating form control rules.

ul.li: Does each form control have a label (e.g. accessible name)?
Are fieldset/legend used for radio groups and groups of related controls?
How are required and invalid form controls identified?
Accessibility of error feedback for compatibility with assistive technology?

contents.p: Use AInspector Sidebar for evaluating form link rules.

ul.li: Does each link have an accessible name?

contents.p: Use AInspector Sidebar for evaluating form color contrast.

ul.li: Any elements with color contrast issues?
